meanings.sent1: The blacksmith needed to decarburize the iron to make it stronger.
meanings.sent2: During the manufacturing process, they decarburize the steel to improve its quality.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally decarburized my pencil when trying to erase too hard!
meanings.sent4: The chef's secret recipe involved decarburizing the sauce to enhance its flavor.
meanings.sent5: The scientist demonstrated how to decarburize the metal using a special technique.

meanings.definition: To undergo a process of removing carbon
meanings.sent1: The metal will decarburize naturally over time due to exposure to certain elements.
meanings.sent2: Steel pipes decarburize as they age, affecting their strength.
meanings.sent3: The old car's exhaust system seemed to decarburize itself without any warning!
meanings.sent4: As the fire burned, the wood began to decarburize, releasing a pleasant aroma.
meanings.sent5: Over time, the coal will decarburize, leaving behind pure carbon.

meanings.definition: To cause a substance to lose carbon
meanings.sent1: The high temperature will decarburize the metal, altering its properties.
meanings.sent2: Excessive heat can decarburize the surface of the steel, making it brittle.
meanings.sent3: The careless handling of the fuel can accidentally decarburize it, leading to inefficiency.
meanings.sent4: The volcanic eruption had the power to decarburize the surrounding rocks.
meanings.sent5: The intense pressure in the chamber will decarburize the gas, leaving it pure.
